cleaned_text: In Need Of A Boost? Fatigue affects every part of performance. To achieve daily goals, work targets, or get in a good workout, [energy](https://renuerx.com/recharge-increase-energy-metabolism-and-immunity/) is key. A vitamin deficiency may be the cause of dragging Mondays. So can a specific vitamin get the job done? Is a supplement the right answer for low energy. Get a load of vitamin B When relying on vitamins for energy, no vitamin beats vitamin B. The body is unable to produce vitamin B in the quantities needed for optimal health. But with eight B vitamins to choose from, which type of B gives peak energy? Try B1 for energy Vitamin B1 or thiamine is a water-soluble vitamin in fish, whole grains and nuts. Thiamine converts carbohydrates and fats into glucose. Glucose provides the energy needed for optimal health. A B1 supplement can provide improved [energy](https://www.livescience.com/15657-vitamin-improves-erectile-dysfunction.html). A B1 deficiency not only means low energy but reduced brain and nervous system function. Get a B5 booster B5 or pantothenic acid helps the hair, skin, and even lowers [cholesterol](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/high-blood-cholesterol/in-depth/niacin/art-20046208). But B5 is also vital for energy. B5 works with added B vitamins to convert food into energy. The more B5 present, the greater the energy conversion. Like B12, B5 helps red blood cell creation and metabolic health. B3 for energy and the body If mushrooms or avocado are on the menu, so is a big dose of B3. Vitamin B3 or niacin gained popularity in the medical field for the treatment of cholesterol. Yet, niacin helps with revving metabolism and stimulating blood flow, much like B5. Vitamin B3 also improves sexual health and energy, giving a boost in the bedroom! Vitamin B6 for sustained vigor Do any of the B vitamins work harder than B6? B6 or pyridoxine helps with muscle repair, combating [anemia](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/vitamin-deficiency-anemia/symptoms-causes/syc-20355025), brain function and much more. More importantly, B6 converts proteins, fats, and carbohydrates to glucose. The vitamin manages energy use too and prolonged energy can be expected when taking a B6 supplement. The energy benefits of B12 Vitamin B12 along with B6 are best for energy. Almost every cell in the body uses B12. Besides helping form red blood cells, B12 converts fat and protein to energy. A B12 deficiency causes tiredness and anemia. If a lack of energy is a problem, reach for a dose of B12. The bottom line? B is good for energy. The truth is, the eight B vitamins contribute in a unique way to metabolism. The more efficient the metabolism, the more efficient the energy. Vitamins like B5 and B6 work together. B12 is energy-boosting along with B6. Pharmacists and doctors often suggest a high-quality B-complex supplement. A B-complex supplement provides the daily recommended B vitamins in a single dosage.
